You tilt your neck and startle. You saw all kinds of red colored feathers, you whole arm was covered in it. Your chest had white feathers. You move your arms and open your hands wide and notice white feathers on the bottom side there. Then you realize they were wings. The tips of the wings had green feathers. You could feel a tail too, which had a similar wing pattern.

You wondered if you were dreaming.


Your sight focus loosened. Behind you were lots of human heads sticking above each other. Several rows of chairs filled with lots and lots of people in each column. You hear a lot of them speak right through each other, it’s not really understandable. You tilt your head back forward and stand normally, well you’re not sure if it’s normal, it feels so restful, it’s almost sitting and you know you’re slightly tilted forward instead of sitting straight, due to your size and weight.

You realized what happened and what you now were, you just couldn’t believe it. Yet somehow it all feels weirder even if you think about it. Your breathing is accelerated in comparison with your previous body, you don’t however feel faster thinking, but you can diffidently move and see faster. You stare at the road and notice several signs and trees. It doesn’t look familiar to you. Suddenly a man next to you stands up, making you startle. You keep him in your sight for a while. The man speaks in five different languages, saying you’re going to some Hotel for the night soon, but first stop at the next town for some sightseeing. You realize you were dragged along the touring bus. That can’t be a good thing. You just wanted to be a bird for a moment, not forever you suddenly feel.

“Hey.”, you say. Your voice sounds weird. Your first try on the word hey sounded like a wraaye. You try again. “Hey”. Now it sounded like a hrey. Better but not good enough. You guess if you lengthen it it sounds like a typical parrot squeak. Your voice doesn’t make it any better either. It’s hard controlling what words come out with beak and these vocal cords.

“Yes my friend Perry?”

The man that was just telling about the plans suddenly turns his smile towards you. You can’t believe he called you Perry. You start to regret your choice already. If only you could get out of here.

“Can I get out?”

“Ho ho ho, of course. Everyone gets out at the next town, including you my friend.”

Even though your words are sounding better, this isn’t good. You’re not sure what to do now. Maybe you should jump out of a window. You’re a bird after all, you should be able to fly somewhere. The man looks at you concerned.

“Is everything alright Perry? Normally you say things short and twice, followed by some whistling. Are you feeling okay my friend.”

A passenger behind him immediate drags his attention with a reply.

“Dude, birds can’t talk. Well, he can, but he doesn’t us. Leave him alone.”

“Perry is smarter than you think young mister. He is a genius.”

“Yeah yeah I know. He can always find it’s home even if you’d throw him out of the window right now, right?”

“Well, basically yes, but you should not be so mean to Perry. Perry is a beautiful bird and a friend.”

“Whatever.”


He is right, you’re not really acting like a real parrot yet. Maybe it gets you into trouble if you keep this up.

“I’m fine, I’m fine.”, you say followed by some weird squeaks and whistle sounds.

“There there is my Perry.”


You look around and try to act as bird as possible. You feel like a living camera. The bird has some sharp eyes and a nice tunnel vision focus. Very detailed. You side step and turn your face towards the back and see if there is any open window, while tilting your head sideways from time to time. No luck. Suddenly the car needs to break, lifting the swing on which you stand up almost hitting the ceiling. Without thinking in a startle you grab the wood with your feet and flap your arms and hands a few times to rebalance and turn face forwards. While the swing is swinging back and forth and you are trying to maintain balance you look outside. There is car parked outside in front of the window on a very sharp turn with little view on the road.

“Idiot”, you say and let out a little rage roar, followed by a laugh in your head. It felt a little itchy when your tail got hit by the ceiling, but your reaction time was amazing. You don’t understand exactly why you did what you did, but you think you’re starting to get the hang of controlling your current form. This body feels in very good condition and you’re glad. You can’t wait to try out flying.

“Oh, sorry Perry, my friend. Here.”

The man hands you a nut or something. You grab it with your beak and somehow it smells eatable, or maybe it’s your imagination. You use one foot to hold it a little and move your beak yaws in a rapid motion to quickly twist and peel of the cover. You break the nut into pieces. Then with a few bends up and down you can swallow the nut. Yummy. You blink a few times and startle.

How the heck did you know what to do. It seemed so logical, yet you’re surprised to find that you can move your foot up that high. It must be you, you guess… or you’re starting to connect with the birds mind a little. You just hope you stay yourself.


A moment passes, you’re not sure how much. You were filling time playing with your beak in your wings a little. It was itching at some spots. Suddenly the bus stops and lets everyone out. You realize you can grab this moment to fly off to somewhere, or you could stay sand see what happens.
155322.title: Turned in a bird

1553221.content:
Of course you’d run away. That guy who probably is your “owner” is freaking you out a little with his “my friend” quotes and those tourists made a whole mess around your plans before. You think you have seen enough of them for one day.

You wait for the last guy to leave, then jump of the swing using your arms, your wings, as a chute to land. You hop to the edge of the stair case and exit the bus with a nice jump and some flaps, landing in a grass field. That translator guy notices what you and offers his hand. You jump and grab his finger with your feet and try to maintain balance while he carries you.

This is weird, you think.

You feel a nice breeze and decide to look around. There is a monument in front of you. You see a couple of roads and buildings, but only one tree. You guess there really isn’t much to do here.

“Can I go?”

“Hm?”

The man holding you replies with a weird stare to your question. You realize from this distance, you are slightly taller than his whole face which looks weird, so you give him the weird stare back. You wonder what the problem is, but then it hits you. It’s pretty weird for an animal to ask something, let alone permission to run away.

“My my young Perry. You are getting smarter by the minute aren’t you? Where would you go?”

“Home.”

There is a small pause now. You wonder if you did something wrong again. Then it hits you and you correct yourself.

“Home. Home. I’m going home.” *whistle* *whistle*

“Oh… ho ho ho ho ho.”

The man pets your head softly and gives you a nut. You eat it in a record speed.

“Very well, I know you can find your way. Just be careful my friend.”

You jump of his finger and take the skies, leaving with a message.

“Bye, I’ll fly.” *whistle*


Every flap makes your breathe rate accelerate. Your heartbeat increases. You flap your arms and hands and notice every push pushes you up and every lift balances you. You subconsciously move your hands in a weird pattern you feel, but don’t mind since it is working in your favor. You lift your feet up and stretch your tail, noticing that where it to points you go. After taking several meters in the air you start to feel very warm and aerodynamic somehow. At some point you notice the winds get very strong allowing you to hover and take things slower, as well as getting to breathe at a little more accepting rate. You fly up slightly even higher. And then just let it float. You look down. it’s amazing what this body can do. It feels really strong. You think you can fly for a while. The view is amazing. You let out a shout of happiness, but your bird voice made it sound really weird.


You look around for a little while and start to recognize where you are. It looks like the outskirts of a town you once saw on online mapping pictures. It’s a few miles away from the hangar where your lab is. You think with a bus it takes about 20 minutes. It probably did so last time, you realize. You know the road the bus came from. It runs through a forest as well as some fields, but it’s basically and mostly a straight line. You know your lab, the hangar, it was in is somewhere in the outskirts of town. This town is it’s neighbor. It shouldn’t be that far.

Since you feel like you need a reason and direction to fly, you decide to go there. You’re not sure where else to go. You find the right height so that the wind is in your favor and mainly glide your way back. While you’re on your way, you enjoy the excitement of flying and view on the world. You feel like a ruler of the skies. You feel free and be able to do anything, even though it is eating your stamina, especially when you’re not looking forward. Several times you need to readjust your height to get the wind in your favor again and luckily you can feel whether you need to go up or down due to the wind blowing along your body, but still... you can tell you can’t maintain this forever. Especially the take off was difficult and tiring, but anyway you aren’t worrying too much about it. You’re not planning on leaving south for the winter yet.

At some point flying alone becomes rather boring. Maybe because it’s tiring. You seek distraction and so you came up with the idea of thinking weird stuff about every house you see. You also comment on cars and people. Eventually you get the idea of taking a dump on a car. You feel like something is building in your belly somewhere anyway. You take a few careful calculations, not adjusting your speed and height you take careful look at how long a car takes to pass you along with taking in account the wind and gravity for how you must aim. Then with the next upcoming car, you give a sudden hard push. Some white warm shit is falling from your behind and you feel a little bit emptier. You closely look how it falls down, how it almost hits the front of a blue car and then, splash! It was a success. Part of the window on the driver’s seat got covered in your shit. Very entertaining, though the winds make your butt feel a little bit wet and cold now.

You get near the town of your destination now. The hangar should be around here somewhere. You feel your tummy rumble. Sigh, you just had a nut already, but you guess you need to eat more. You think you left a bag of chips in your lab somewhere. If you could just find it. Ah!

You carefully circle down a little and try to maintain position in height as you look for a nice place to land. Oddly the door of your lab is open. Right, you left it open. Then you notice a black car. A guy in a business suit exits your lab and goes to the car, only to drive away after wards. You land on your lab’s rooftop, the roof of a hangar and stare at the car as it is driving away. You could easily see the license plate and the man’s face, but you have no idea who it is.


You jump of the building and head into the open doorway, into your lab. Everything is as you left it, only a lot quieter. All the people are gone, your body is gone. The rest is all still there. You jump and fly towards your desk and step towards the computer. Entering a code turns the screen on, which you do with your feet and beak. The first thing you see is the log screen of your probe transfer. It was a complete success. You tick a few keys and ready for the next program, with is the original version. You don’t think you want to stay a bird forever, but at the moment you have no problem with it.

You jump around one eighty degrees and jump again to fly towards a closet. You pull it open with your feet by flying and grab the bag of chips with your beak. At the same time a lot of paperwork flies around the room. You’re making a lot of wind you guess.

You tear the bag open with your beak and grab a chip with your foot claw. You start eating some chips on the usual bird way, digging of not drilling chips down by pecking. After you ate three outside the bag, you decide it’s easier to stick your whole hear inside the bag and eat like a monster. All the rumbling sound of the bad and your insane eating made you so busy, you didn’t notice anything else anymore. It’s just too loud and active, but you like it. Till the moment you startle.

“Hello?! Rick Carter FBI. Is someone there? Uh.. what the?”

You quickly turn your body around. A face was sticking inside your lab from the doorway. (Shit), you think. You realize you have to hurry. Luckily this body is fast. You jump up and fly only to quickly land on your keyboard key to disable the monitor. Immediately after you jump and make a few flaps to land on top of the monitor, which you grab and hold sturdy with your feet. You give the guy a deadly bird stare.

“Dude, what’s going on.”

Another guy appeared. This one is probably his partner. A black guy with deep brown eyes and a nice old fashioned short haircut. He is pretty huge too. You wonder what his name is, so you know who to avoid. That Rick guy is white, has outstandingly huge eyebrows. Brown eyes and an average posture. He doesn’t really look like a serious and kind guy. He looks more like the type that teases people, but you can’t judge on appearances you guess.

“It’s a bird.”

“So?”

“Well… it was eating chips.”

“I still don’t get it. It’s probably his pet or something. Man, I just can’t believe he leaves it alone like this. Where’s it’s food and water?”

“We’re not here to judge people on their way of treating pets.”

“Yeah yeah…”


What the heck do they want? Just as you ask that, you hear a third male voice. A familiar voice.

“Uh excuse me. What are you doing here?”

“Rick Carter FBI. Mind If I ask you some questions?”

You can hear he startled. You know who it is, you just forgot his name. Maybe you should have paid more attention to people, not that it matters.

“Excuse me, what are you three doing here.”

A woman now joined the party. Who are they? Why the heck do the talk in the door path. Two outside, two inside. Sigh.
“I could ask you the same question. Rick Carter FBI. This is my partner Kane Pennington. We’d like to ask you a few questions.”

“A few questions, well I have a few questions myself.”

“Do you mind showing us some ID?”

“Sigh, it’s always the same with you.”

“You too fellow.”

The other guy doesn’t sound like he is very confident.


You do know one thing. You can’t really let them snoop around without your permission, but at the moment you can’t really identify yourself. You probably won’t be taken very seriously if you’d talk to them since you’re basically a pet. Maybe you need a human body after all. In that case they need to go inside, which you rather have not. What should you do?
1553221.title: Your first flight

15532211.content:
“L-look I uh”

The woman suggests to the third guy not to talk to them, surprisingly. You notice the two FBI agents are looking at each other for a second and then back outside.

“Uhm look, he needs to talk to us.”

“He needs to talk with me first.”

“Again, we’re the FBI.”

“So what?”

“Excuse me.”

“Just because you need to talk to him doesn’t make it so that he needs to talk to you. He always has the right to refuse and besides, I am sure he’ll talk to you after we have had a little private conversation.”

“Right and again, who are you?”

“Sigh”


A moment of silence enters, but then suddenly all hell breaks loose again.

“IMF? What the hell is the IMF doing here?”

“Well excuse me. I’m just here for personal reasons.”

“Right. Well, you’re interrupting an official federal investigation. Please go do your business elsewhere.”

“Very well.”


The woman walks inside, making you able to see her clearly and as if a coin fell, you almost immediately fell in love. She looks young, about aged in the twenties. She has blue eyes and this cattish seductive look in her eyes. Blond long hair wrapped up in a long pony tail which has a few decorations and leans on her shoulder so that most of her hair is in front of her. She wears a black opened blazer with a white blouse underneath of which both the sleeves are wrapped up a little just below the elbow. The top buttons of the blouse are opened showing her beautiful skin and her chest decoration which is a golden necklace and partly a nice looking bra and a pair of breasts. She also wears black trousers matching her blazer and a pair of black heels which also reveal skin. You could tell from the cloths she isn’t poor. Probably a capable of a lot too.

You startle when she suddenly looks at you and approaches. Those eyes are demonic, they completely freeze you and make you feel as if you’re being blessed by heaven. Someone in your head you want to shout for help, but everything else just triggers weird fantasies. You cannot hear what they say and what she says as she approaches you, all because of your manly hormones and perverted fantasies. Suddenly she touches you in your neck. You could see white wings behind her, wrapping around you. She is trying to tell you she loves you. Are you in heaven, you wonder. Of course that is all in your mind. What really happened was the following. She saw you, took interests immediately and starts petting you below your neck, because you’re a parrot.

“My aren’t you a cute little parrot.”

“Hey, you can’t come in here.”

“You told me to go elsewhere, didn’t you?”

She turned her head around and stopped touching you. You could not get your eyes of her. Her skin was beautiful and as she turns her face back towards you, you could see the darkness in the split between her two breasts. It turned you on so hard, you got frightened. You want to avoid losing yourself in your fantasy again so you look elsewhere but her lips suddenly turn into a smile, making you look at her again. It was too late. Her face is too much and that body. You sink away into your inner perverted world.

“Hooot… hot babe. Tell me your name. Marry me.”

Ouch, that came out wrong. Heck you did not even want to say anything. You feel completely embarrassed, but she just smiled and laughed a little, causing you to loop back into her charm and your fantasy mode.

“I knew you could talk.”


Meanwhile the FBI agents do not really know what to do anymore. They just talk to each other a little till the third guy walks in. Obviously you heard that on the background, but you were too focused on the girl that was treating your feathers.

“Uh you know, you all can’t come in here. It’s not your place, you know.”

“Oh great, now you too start fighting our protocols.”

“That wasn’t”

“Hey guys”, the girl suddenly interferes. “What do you think of this parrot?”

“That’s not important right now.”

The girl points her finger in her jaw and looks up. She looks so cute. She turns her face towards the FBI agents and suggests something.

“Well, it is because someone is going to need to take care of him.”

“Well, the FBI is busy.”

She turns her face towards you again and starts petting you with a smile. You think you can’t handle it much longer. Meanwhile the other FBI agent, Kane was staring silently at a machine in your lab.

“Rick, what do you think this is?”

“I have honestly no idea, but it’s clearly made for humans to use.”


Suddenly the girl stops petting you and walks towards it. You were nearly coming too, you think. Disappointed you look in their direction.

They were staring at your original nanoprobe machine. It uses a different set of nanoprobes and smaller vials. It injects nanoprobes into the invader, which then download the whole consciousness and then they return to the machine, which then sends the nanoprobes into the host, where the consciousness is being uploaded. It works excellently. The problem is the nanoprobes left in the host are basically scrap metal after wards. So you need another vial if you want to transfer again. Eventually this causes metal poisoning to the body if you do it too soon so there should be a long delay between uses. It is also less portable. With your new nanoprobes, which are airborne, you basically only need a computer and some software. If the target body is in range you could reuse the nanoprobes in your current body, by uploading a new command set using the right software and they would start downloading your brain and leave your body, traveling through air to the target. So you think it failed a little with the giant heavy machine. As these were much safer for health too. However it is completely operational if turned on.

The woman turns it on. A display shows some images.

“What the hell are you doing?”

“Well, didn’t you ask what it was?”

“Well, not me. It was my partner, but anyway, don’t you know what happened here?”

“Obviously not.”

The agent who calls himself Rick all the time places his hand palm in his face and continues.

“Seriously.”

“Yes, and you?”

Rick walks around nervously. Meanwhile his partner is taking a look at some of your barrels and closets, opening them and peeking inside.

“Dude whoever lived here has some strange intentions. What do you think this is?”

He is holding a vial, a piece of glass filled with a little bit of mercury looking liquid, which he took from one of the barrels. Those are the nanoprobes for the machine that was just turned on. This looks bad.

The girl steals it and places it in the machine slot. Everyone looks weird at her.

“What? It was in the instruction here… They are for this machine.”

Suddenly the two pods their internal lightning activates. Kane draw out a different vial from another barrel. One with what seems like water. It is actually the new type airborne nanoprobes, solved in hydrogen with salt, made ready for programming and injection.

“This one has a number on it.”

Rick looks at Kane and starts thinking.

“Well, this is a lab.”

“What do you think is going on here?”

“Well, I guess he was trying to make a mercury bomb. The transparent liquid is obviously nitroglycerin.”

“Crap.”

He places the vial back quickly. They aren’t very bright. The numbers you put on the transparent vials are for group indication, which you need for their programming. Sigh.

“I don’t think he was making bombs.”

The girl suddenly makes a suggestion. It sounds like she has more brains then these two. The two man walk towards her and stare at the screen. The woman walks into a pod and starts taking a closer look at the sensors and lights inside.

“The screen clearly displace this has something to do with humans.”

Oh yeah, this machine was also limited to human only. The injector needs to be at the right height after all. The girl continues.

“I thought it was supposed to be a scanner of some kind, but it looks more like it creates some sort of link between two people. I’m not sure why it would need mercury to operate though. It cannot be good for your health.”

“Do you think he was experimenting on humans?”

“Well, this suggests it.”

“Right, I’m calling the federal computer analysts and forensics. Kane!? Call the analysts and forensics.”

“Yes sir.”

“Now then, as for you. I still am going need to ask you a few questions, so stop what you are doing before you get involved.”

“Involved in what?”


“Uhm.” Sudden words come from a dark corner in the lab. Everyone startles. The woman hits her head against the pod. A loud BEEP immediately echoes through the room, the entry door closes and locks electronically. At the same time the pod lid closes and locks, waiting for the other one to be filled to begin transfer. Rick freaks out. Kane dropped his phone. You nearly jump of the monitor. Everyone suddenly looks in the same direction. The third guy.

Things are about to go wrong, will you act?
15532211.title: Federal Visitors in the Lab

155322111.content:
“Uh, help?”

You hear soft bangs hitting thick glass. The woman is struggling inside the pod and cannot seem to get out. Of course you know the reason why. It’s part of the programming.

“Can someone get this pod open?”

“How about the door.”

Agent Rick notices the front door got locked as well.

“There seems to be some interference. I can’t make a call.”

Agent Kane attempts many times to call someone without luck. Everyone sighs and turn their faces towards the third guy. The silent one who suddenly spoke and started this chain reaction.

“Right. You were here too. Well, it’s all your fault. We got locked inside this lab, without food, without water, without phone signal, we’re screwed. Thank you.”

“Uh Rick, we have phone signal, but something is just jamming it. We also have water.”

Kane points to the water tab on a lab table. That was pretty mean of Rick to blame everything on the third guy. You know him, it’s always been like this. He just has a bit of a low presence issue. No one notices him and when they do he either gets teased or causes bad luck for others. Well, it’s not his fault. People just don’t take the time to notice him around. Now he looks sad to the ground.

“Thank you for correcting me Kane.”

Rick is pissed. He kicks the wall, which you had enforced with metal plating, causing a loud sound to echo. Then he starts pointing fingers towards the closed pod.

“And it’s all because of you. If you would have just listened to us, if we could just have a bit of a word, we wouldn’t even have been in here, let alone in this situation. We have a protocol. We have an investigation to handle and you, you’re just being in our way, obstructing our investigation. When you get out of there, I’m going to have you get arrested for this.”

“Well excuse me then.”

“God.”


The third guy stares at the machine, more precisely at the closed pod with the woman inside. He places his hand softly against the glass and she does the same at the same spot. They’re staring each other in the eye.

Meanwhile Rick retains focus and checks the console on the machine. He presses all sorts of buttons, but nothing much happens.

“Kane, you try it.”

“Fine.”

Kane now checks the same console while Rick is watching. The third guy is distracting you strangely as he is playing with your feelings right now, feelings for her. You’re still on top of the monitor on your desk, which operates most of the system remotely. Everything in your lab is connected, so you know the machine’s protocol closed the front door. Normally your electronic card comes in handy, but since your body was taken somewhere by someone the woman is in some bad luck. The only way to save her now is with the abort command which has to be inputted on the device directly. You could activate your airborne nanoprobes thought and take possession of a new body. That would overwrite the current program, because it is in waiting phase, waiting for someone to enter which pod holds the invader and which the new host as well as for the other pod to be filled. No actual transfer has started yet, so when you start a transfer with your own probes it should end with resetting all programs, unlocking the door and pod.

The problem is, you’re a big bird currently. You need to jump down and if you enter a code they can easily take over your console unless you quickly activate the program, so you have no time to type all sorts of things to find a way to open the pod from here. You could fly over to the console on the machine and enter the abort code there, but you’d probably be chased away since they are foolish. Maybe they’ll even tie you up for not listening. You can’t risk that. You feel so useless at the moment.


There is someone who can save her though, the silent guy. You still can’t remember his name, but you remember he came here a lot, which is awkward. For some reason people easily forget about him.

He first came to your lab while he was wondering off far away from home, so it was pretty random. Since you didn’t expect any visitors and the lab was a sauna due to summer time, you had the door open. You startled so badly that day. It turned out he was extremely smart, like you. Too bad he has some communication issues. He is the most introverted person you have ever met, well you guess you can’t blame him. What’s weird though is that he is extremely kind and compassionate, even though he basically went through the same thing as you, if not worse. His life is a hell, it’s making him crazy, yet he always says “better me then someone else”. What the heck. You’d go rage against god and make sure you’d be able to escape your life, by building this thing. He could do the same, but he is just too busy being depressed, caring, inconfident and self hating. You don’t get it, but that’s because you’re different even though there are so many similarities.

Thanks to him, you altered your plan. He even helped you develop the airborne types and with the programming. Of course you mainly did all the work, but still he was able to draw it out with so much details. You just can’t believe he never went to high school.

Apparently he got teased badly and forcefully quit school early. With his past and that personality you can’t blame him. He’s incredibly weak footed, doesn’t want to fight back because he doesn’t want to hurt others. He got teased by his parents, by his neighborhood. Everyone called him a liar, which started because of his siblings who usually did something bad and abused his low presence by pointing fingers and working together. Since he didn’t have a big mouth and couldn’t prove the opposite, he was just being called liar all the time. No one believed him and took him serious.

Eventually he didn’t get to have any friends, even though he is the type that would be appreciated by everyone, just because of people teasing him and his own misfortune. He is bad in communication skills because of a fear he developed. He never knows how to say what he wants. He looks normal, well quiet. Guess what the reason is. When he talks, something goes wrong.

On about his twentieth age he got diagnosed with some sort of small form of autism, a so called developmental disorder. No one ever noticed, but ever since they take all his behavior for something autistic.

All that, together with the fact that he was struggling all his life with gender identity issues he didn’t understand till he was in puberty made things very unreal for him. He realized his mom was just using him, blackmailing him and his feelings into doing stuff. He got used by almost everyone. He never had a chance to say his own things and if he did he got punished, because it was wrong and against protocol. His family is pretending to be poor and he was supposed to be the savior or the person his parents could leech money from. He was forced to grow up as a perfect and normal guy, which is completely against his own true self and got punished for not being able to do that. His life must feel like a lie. He was most diffidently born in the wrong body and the wrong life, but with everything that has happened he isn´t being taken seriously since people don´t separate things once they are grouped.

Because of that he can’t get treatment for anything. Also because he has such low self confidence and persistence in himself and his opinions, he doubts everything due to his fear. The doctors he has just tell him everything he has is caused by autism, so he can’t go anywhere. It doesn’t matter he suffers. No one has money for him anyway, so a surgery would be too expensive. They always had some excuse.

You know all this because he told you, which made you hate society a little and since his relation with his family was so similar to yours you couldn´t help but to get a bit hating towards him too for reminding you of yourself, which you regret. You remember what he told you.

“It doesn´t matter. I don’t feel like I am existing you see. They aren’t actually teasing me. I’m nothing more but a lie. They just tease what they see, which hurts but it’s not me so, I’m okay.”

He tells himself stuff like that every time something bad happens since he gets reminded of everything every time just to keep sanity. If he gets fired, no problems. If he gets hit, no problems. If he gets nearly killed, it’s okay. It pisses you off a little how he cares about himself. He is depressed. He wants to kill himself, but he decides not to.


When you met him, you thought you’d offer him a chance to run from his hell when you offered him a nanoprobe treatment. He could be anyone he wanted. He looked at you with those sparkling eyes of hope and turned to tears, yet he said no because he didn’t want to hurt anyone else. He didn’t want them to feel like he did, even though it’s probably the only way. He also said he’d be forced to serve you for the rest of his life is he did that, due to his honor. Well, his arms and legs are clearly still shaking. He looks at the agents and the girl.

Who would do that to you? Sigh, you have the bird’s mind, but as far you haven’t been able to suddenly remember something on will, even though it should be possible. This is a problem.

You try hard to remember. You imagine yourself outside on a stick. It’s sunny, there’s a man calling you friend all the time next to you. Suddenly you trigger something. A memory appears.

(“My Perry is amazing. He can fly from anywhere, he still finds way home.” )

No that’s not it. You look further.

( “Wa- What’s happening?” … “Oh no, quick Perry. We need to leave.” … “You’re not going anywhere.” –who’s voice is that? – “As far as I’m concerned, you are all gonna watch. Be quiet or we’ll take you down as well.” –the guy is threatening the tourists. They’re getting dragged back inside the bus- “Shut up or we’ll blow the parrot.” –They take you outside- “M-my Perry.” …) then it happens.

Wow, that was weird. It’s there indeed, in your head. It’s like a weird conflicting memory and it’s pretty faint, but you can tell what happened. You can’t believe it. You saw yourself getting beaten up.


You explain what happened and had to think hard of the details. You recognized a set of tattoos eventually. He thanks you and lets you go. He was planning on taking you to the animal caretaker or back to your real owner, but since you told him so much without resisting he changed his mind. Still he wonders why you are so smart, what the scientist (you) was doing in that lab, what the machines are for and why people ended up in the hospital. But his protocol states he can’t investigate those. The police can, but he can’t, since there is no case involving them. You’re not answering those questions though.

After the door opens, you realize you’re in the hospital, a different floor and room, but still there. Rick wanted to talk with someone who he refers to as “that IMF witch”, but protocol states he must wait till visitor hour. So he exits the building instead.


You feel a bit strange. It’s like after looking inside your memory, you feel more proud about yourself and more compatible. It’s like you’ve become more bird in your head. It freaks you out a little. You don’t want to be a bird. You need to get rid of your bird body. First things first. You need a replacement body, but to get one might be difficult. You guess you can go meet up with someone and ask for help.

Where will you go?
1553221111121111.title: End of this day. What a long day it was.

15533.content:
The only problem is, you can never test that from here. The Zoo is a bit far away and you have no way of getting there with all those tourists around, nor can you take the machine there. You need to lure an animal here somehow if you really want to do that.

In any case this option is as of yet a no go, but it doesn’t matter you guess. You can always try it later, though it would probably be permanent if you do so. If they catch an animal, they put them in special places you can’t get out and that means you won’t be able to operate the consoles in this lab anymore, nor would you be in range of them so even if you let someone do it remotely you’d still be stuck in that animal.


In any case, you need a different life. You want to be someone else. Right now it didn’t matter who, so you picked someone from the crowd and made sure you’d become that person.

You’re glad the probes are airborne. It saves a lot of trouble. Still though, due to all your doubting and introvert behavior lately you spend a lot of time thinking and not acting. A lot of people left the door already and your choices get limited. The tournament still goes and people are probably going to get angry if they notice you’d still not pick one of them.

When you looked around you noticed a lot of the woman lost. Most of the people left fighting are men. Several people are waiting in the touring bus, but it’s a giant risk to get your probes outside while your mind is inside them due to a sudden wind blows and who knows when it’s going to drive away.

If you doubt much longer they are going to get away. You better choose before it gets a one sided choice.
